ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Question on Loot and Classes
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I agree.  In a pickup group, everyone puts forth the effort to kill the creature that drops an item, and as a result should have the right to rand for it.
ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, 5 Apr 2000, Ken Bachman wrote:

> My own stance on this is: if it isn't no-drop/not bard, or lore/I
> already own it, I have a right to lotto for it. This isn't Baldur's

I agree. In a pickup group, everyone puts forth the effort to
kill the creature that drops an item, and as a result should have the
right to rand for it.

> group, and seeing just how often players pick up and move between guilds,
> I don't even buy it at the guild level. Among very close, trusted
> friends, I'll do it, but even then only if it doesn't happen repeatedly.

Then you've never seen a good guild. My guild has had 4 people
out of about 80 to 100 leave for other guilds. A bunch of my guildmates
have retired from EQ, but obviously that's not the same thing. The
Pantheon has similar numbers (Sylly?). I heavily urge you to read
Gallenite/Jarik's treatise on looting:
http://pantheon.worldshock.com/articles/looting/index.htm

It covers everything you have addressed here, and more.

--
